title: Saracens announce departure of board director at same time as England's Rugby World Cup semi-final in Japan
text:
Saracens director Nick Leslau is stepping down from his role after 20 years with the club.

The news was released on Saturday at the same time as England’s Rugby World Cup semi-final kicked off against New Zealand in Japan, when six of Saracens’ leading players were featuring in England’s starting XV in Yokohama.

Leslau’s departure comes at a time when the reigning Gallagher Premiership and European champions are awaiting the results of a six-month investigation for allegedly abusing the Premiership salary cap. He himself has not been accused of any wrongdoing.
